body:
Am I missing something? Is errno a reserved word in cython?

    cdef class Foo:
        cdef int errno
        def __init__(self):
            self.errno = 5

Errors:
Python 3.6.4 (v3.6.4:d48ecebad5, Dec 18 2017, 21:07:28) 
[GCC 4.2.1 (Apple Inc. build 5666) (dot 3)] on darwin
Type "help", "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.
>>> import pyximport; pyximport.install()
(None, <pyximport.pyximport.PyxImporter object at 0x1018dd160>)
>>> import errno1
/Users/Ceti/.pyxbld/temp.macosx-10.6-intel-3.6/pyrex/errno1.c:741:7: warning: this function declaration is not a prototype [-Wstrict-prototypes]
  int errno;
      ^
/usr/include/sys/errno.h:81:24: note: expanded from macro 'errno'
#define errno (*__error())
                       ^
/Users/Ceti/.pyxbld/temp.macosx-10.6-intel-3.6/pyrex/errno1.c:741:7: error: field '__error' declared as a function
/usr/include/sys/errno.h:81:17: note: expanded from macro 'errno'
#define errno (*__error())
                ^
/Users/Ceti/.pyxbld/temp.macosx-10.6-intel-3.6/pyrex/errno1.c:1125:17: error: expected identifier
  __pyx_v_self->errno = 5;
                ^
/usr/include/sys/errno.h:81:15: note: expanded from macro 'errno'
#define errno (*__error())
              ^
/Users/Ceti/.pyxbld/temp.macosx-10.6-intel-3.6/pyrex/errno1.c:1180:50: error: expected identifier
  __pyx_t_1 = __Pyx_PyInt_From_int(__pyx_v_self->errno); if (unlikely(!__pyx_t_1)) __PYX_ERR(0, 3, __pyx_L1_error)
                                                 ^
/usr/include/sys/errno.h:81:15: note: expanded from macro 'errno'
#define errno (*__error())
              ^
/Users/Ceti/.pyxbld/temp.macosx-10.6-intel-3.6/pyrex/errno1.c:1784:25: error: expected identifier
  __pyx_v___pyx_result->errno = __pyx_t_2;
                        ^
/usr/include/sys/errno.h:81:15: note: expanded from macro 'errno'
#define errno (*__error())
              ^
1 warning and 4 errors generated.
title: Attribute errno causes errors during compile
